blog.name: badthingshappenbingopromos
blog.title: Bad Things Happen Promos
blog.description: Why do bad things happen to good people? Because it's more fun to write.

summary: Do you like writing fan fiction? Do you have certain fictional characters to whom you are just irrevocably attached? Do you want...
caption:
Do you like writing fan fiction? Do you have certain fictional characters to whom you are just irrevocably attached? Do you want to write about them at all times? Do you need a little push to start on a new fic for them?

Do you want to make them suffer?

Then it’s time to play a game…

Bad Things Happen Bingo is a multifandom writing prompt game with a special focus on whump, angst, hurt/comfort, and just bad things happening. Anyone can participate, and there’s no end to what you might find in the darkest corners of your imagination.

🚑 Main Blog

🚑 About

tags: otp: when the sun has set
summary: black spills over the pillows, bathed in silver, crowned in gold. the king, sleeping in the moonlight from the window. morning,...
body:
black spills over the pillows, bathed in silver, crowned in gold. the king, sleeping in the moonlight from the window.

morning, and eyes as blue as the sea outside the castle, laughter on his lips, five freckles - how often i have counted - dotted over his nose.

we are so alike, two boys made of silk and steel and gold, with hearts that skip beats when the blue sea sprays and the thunder roars so loud that we have to hide beneath the blankets on the beds.

his hands are smooth where mine are rough, his mouth given to smiles and jests where mine is too often defiant and surly.

the night in the tent, my heart is sore to look at him, to think that he must leave me to go to his wife - who alone is dearest to my heart after him - and his marriage bed.

his hands, smooth and soft and gentle, as though i am made of porcelain, of glass, of crystal - tangle in my hair, winding curls around his fingers. i clutch him to me,

because i can’t bear to let go. he makes a jest, one of his many jokes that ordinarily would make me smile, and yet tonight, it cuts deep. i shove him away, wanting to hurt him as he has hurt me.

he goes to her. or rather, she comes to him, lovely as the dawn and gentle in her coaxing, but all for naught. we are alike in that also, that the charms of women hold no draw for us. we are made for each other.

we are made for the hands we have held since childhood, made for the mouths we have kissed in lashing stormlands rain and under the crashing roll of thunder, made for the hearts and souls of a king and a knight.

i made him promise one night in the sept, as i held my vigil, the seven oils glistening on my skin, naked before him, that he would never go anywhere i could not follow. he swore that night

that i would be always at his side, wherever he went, and he kissed me there in the sight of gods and men to seal the vow, a marriage of sorts.

that night in the stormlands, he went. i could not follow, no matter how i fought and raged at the gods for taking him from me. i love him, i cried, and they mocked me as they mock everyone who comes to them.

we were both boys made for love, and for tragedy.

the gods have fashioned us for love; that is our great glory, and our great tragedy. - f.

summary: [Spoilers] Jorah's and Rakharo's conversation in Season One
title: [Spoilers] Jorah's and Rakharo's conversation in Season One
body:
I was wondering if anyone else is bothered by this:

“<…>That’s where the broadsword has the advantage. Designed for piercing plate.<…>”

For one, Jorah is holding a longsword there. And a longsword typically weighs around 1,5 kg. It is a fast, agile and elegant weapon. Not some club with a sharp point, which the show implies. There is no way in the world it would ever pierce plate armour. If it did, what would be the point of armour? And indeed, Jorah contradicts himself immediately after:

“<…>Amour makes a man slow. It’s true, but it also keeps a man alive.<…>”.

If a simple longsword could pierce plate armour (which we actually see multiple times in the show), it doesn’t exactly “help to keep a man alive”.

By the way, talking about plate armour - yes, it was heavier than regular clothing. But no, it wasn’t heavy enough to prevent quick movement. In fact, it is possible to do many types of sports wearing full plate armour. This is mainly because armour did not have to be thick to withstand hits from swords, arrows, and the like. A relatively thin piece of steel was enough.



Source: https://ift.tt/2N9gy6l

summary: Gibt es eine Verbindung zwischen „Westworld“ und „Game of Thrones“?
title: Gibt es eine Verbindung zwischen „Westworld“ und „Game of Thrones“?
body:
Kurz nach dem Staffel-Finale von „Westworld“ sprießen die Theorien darüber, wie die 3. Staffel der komplexen Sci-Fi-Serie aussehen könnte. Ein Fan will in der letzten Folge einen Hinweis darauf gefunden haben, dass zwischen „Westworld“ und „Game of Thrones“ eine Verbindung besteht.

Easter Eggs nennt man versteckte Hinweise oder Referenzen, die in Games, Filmen oder Serien auftauchen und nur von den Findigsten bemerkt werden. Was genau ein solches Osterei ist und was pure Einbildung, ist nicht immer sofort ersichtlich. Und doch ist sich ein „Reddit“-User sicher, im Staffel-Finale von „Westworld“ eine Verbindung zu „Game of Thrones“ entdeckt zu haben.

Dieses Detail ließ einen “Westworld”-Fan aufmerken

Dabei geht es um die Szene, in der Logan (Ben Barnes), Dolores (Evan Rachel Wood) und Bernard (Jeffrey Wright) durch das Lager der über die Gäste gesammelten Informationen führt. Die Daten eines jeden Gastes befinden sich in einem Buch - diese Bücher werden in einer riesigen Bibliothek gesammelt. Und in der gibt es ein Detail, das den „Reddit“-User „ Preferred4″ aufmerken ließ:

Was auf dem Screenshot wie eine Lampe aussieht, erinnert stark an das Gyroskop aus dem Vorspann von „Game of Thrones“. Auch dort ist das Kreiselinstrument hell erleuchtet. Und auch in dieser Serie, deren 8. Staffel die Fans kaum erwarten können, kommt einer Bibliothek eine wichtige Rolle zu. Die der Zitadelle, in der sich alle Geheimnisse finden lassen, die in den Sieben Königslanden von Bedeutung sind.

Vielleicht ist “Game of Thrones” ja ein weiterer Themenpark?

Durch eines der Bücher kam auch die entscheidende Wendung am Ende der siebten Staffel zustande. Jon Snow ist der Sohn von Lyanna Stark und Rhaegar Targaryen, die heimlich verheiratet waren. Damit ist Jon Snow der rechtmäßige Erbe des Eisernen Throns.

Nun würden die meisten Fans wohl nicht so weit gehen, zu behaupten, das „Game-of-Thrones“-Universum wäre nur ein weiterer Themenpark von Delos. Und doch macht es einfach zu viel Spaß, sich mit solchen Theorien zu befassen, bis Jon, Daenerys und Dolores endlich wieder auf den Bildschirm zurückkehren.

Die erste Staffel „Westworld“ ist auf Sky Go, Sky On Demand und Sky Ticket mit Sky Box Sets verfügbar. Die zweite Staffel läuft auf Sky Go, Sky On Demand, Sky Ticket und Sky Atlantic HD. Noch bis zum 8. Oktober stehen alle Folgen von „Game of Thrones“ auf Sky On Demand, Sky Go und Sky Ticket zum Abruf bereit.

(Bilder: ddp, Screenshot HBO)

summary: Imagine being such a raging asshole that instead of focusing on the fact that people helped raise over $1000 for a charity that...
body: Imagine being such a raging asshole that instead of focusing on the fact that people helped raise over $1000 for a charity that benefits real women, all they can focus on is how much they dislike that those people prefer a differing ship of fictional characters in a fictional story.

summary: It’s not easy being drunk all the time. Everyone would do it, if it were easy.
text: It’s not easy being drunk all the time. Everyone would do it, if it were easy.
source:
Tyrion Lannister (Game Of Thrones)


I mean like, I guess this true, but everyone does get drunk sometimes.

summary: My life, as told through GoT seasons
title: My life, as told through GoT seasons
body:
Season 1: The nice boy I was dating told me that there some new fantasy TV show coming out that had been majorly hyped, and he asked if I’d be interested in watching it with him. I knew what he was talking about because I had seen the poster on the side of EVERY single bus for the last month. We watched the first episode on his mattress-on-milkcrates, in his messy little warehouse room. Later episodes were watched on my laptop at the table in my townhouse with Mum. 

Season 2 and 3: I didn’t watch Season 2 when it came out. I ended up only watching it just before Season 3 at the insistence from my housemates. I now lived in the aforementioned warehouse. We watched Season 2 in batches on the couch during those wonderfully unemployed days. and watched Season 3 as each episode came out. We sang the lyrics with great gusto before every episode. 

Season 4: The aforementioned housemates, the aforementioned boyfriend and I had a big glorious sharehouse (not share-warehouse) and we were very proud of it. Every Tuesday, we invited everyone from the respective houses to join us for “Game of Thronesing” - there was always between 10 and 20 people crowded into the living room, watching on a makeshift projector screen. Some times some people just brought their left-overs for dinner, and for others, we cooked big glorious winter feasts for everyone. Singing the lyrics as LOUDLY as you could during the theme song was now tradition, and my favourite part of the night. Also, there was the Guy. Over the course of the season, we went from shyly making awkward conversation and trying to sit next to each other if there was room, to watching episodes whilst holding hands, and he would sleep in my bed afterwards. 

Season 5: Most episodes were watched with just me, my boyfriend, and his other girlfriend, in the apartment Boyfriend and I now shared. The Guy was always invited, but very rarely made it because of his work schedule. I missed the big social gathering that Game of Thonesing used to be (everyone was now watching in their own houses), and felt slightly empty during this season. It didn’t help that the season didn’t actually get good until Hardhome. 

Season 6: The first episode, my boyfriend and I watched on our couch in our apartment, and I almost cried with relief of how good it was in contrast to season 5. It was the only episode we watched together - by episode two, we had broken up. Later episodes were watched alone, either on my laptop in my bed (with headphones, trying to stay as silent and non-existent as possible), or on the couch in the Guy (now Boyfriend’s) room. I felt very lonely watching The Door alone. But the later episodes were watched together with my now one-and-only boyfriend, on the big projector screen on his couch.

Season 7: His couch is Our couch now. The house is now entirely our house. We also have a housemate, my sister’s boyfriend. Sometimes my sister comes over too, and we all watch the season together on the big projector screen. I check reddit after every episode.
